org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.faces

Class MessageFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.faces.MessageFactory

  • public class MessageFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of static factory methods for generating Faces error messages. Faces messages can be local (associated with a specific component by name) or global (not associated with any component).
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      MessageFactory()

    • Method Detail

      • createGlobalErrorFromException

        public static void createGlobalErrorFromException(org.apache.log4j.Logger logger,
                                  java.lang.Throwable e,
                                  java.lang.String detail)
        Create and enqueue a new global Faces message for the UI to display based on an exception and a detail message. Log the combined message to the Logger as an error along with the exception. The method does not re-throw the exception.
        Parameters:
        logger - The log4j Logger to which to log the error
        e - the exception
        detail - the detail message

      • createGlobalError

        public static void createGlobalError(org.apache.log4j.Logger logger,
                     java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.String detail)
        Create a new global Faces message for the UI to display based on a string message and a detail message. Log the combined message to the Logger.
        Parameters:
        logger - the log4j Logger to which to log the error
        message - the message
        detail - the detail message

      • createLocalErrorFromException

        public static void createLocalErrorFromException(org.apache.log4j.Logger logger,
                                 java.lang.Throwable e,
                                 java.lang.String componentId,
                                 java.lang.String detail)
        Create and enqueue a new local Faces message for the UI to display based on an exception and a detail message. Log the combined message to the Logger as an error along with the exception. The method does not re-throw the exception.
        Parameters:
        logger - The log4j Logger to which to log the error
        e - the exception
        componentId - the id of the Faces component with which the error is associated
        detail - the detail message

      • createLocalError

        public static void createLocalError(org.apache.log4j.Logger logger,
                    java.lang.String componentId,
                    java.lang.String message,
                    java.lang.String detail)
        Create a new local Faces message for the UI to display based on a string message and a detail message. Log the combined message to the Logger.
        Parameters:
        logger - the log4j Logger to which to log the error
        message - the message
        componentId - the id of the Faces component with which the error is associated
        detail - the detail message

      • isMessageQueued

        private static boolean isMessageQueued(java.lang.String summary)
        Is a message already queued in the Faces message queue? The message is tested only for summary text, not for level or detail.
        Parameters:
        summary - the message for which to test
        Returns:
        true if the message is queued, false otherwise

      • isErrorQueued

        public static boolean isErrorQueued()
        Is there an ERROR or FATAL message queued up?
        Returns:
        true if there is an error, false if not

      • createGlobalWarningFromException

        public static void createGlobalWarningFromException(org.apache.log4j.Logger logger,
                                    java.lang.Throwable e,
                                    java.lang.String detail)
        Create a new global Faces message for the UI to display based on an exception and a detail message. Log the combined message to the Logger as a warning along with the exception. The method does not re-throw the exception.
        Parameters:
        logger - The log4j Logger to which to log the warning
        e - the exception
        detail - the detail message

        Parameters:
        logger - the log4j Logger to which to log the message
        componentId - the component id for the component that owns the message
        message - the message
        detail - the detail message
